items.title: How to copy parent nodes into current node of SimpleXml
items.body:
I want to split an XML into smaller chunks for further processing. To be self-sufficient for import, each chunk must contain all the information outside their scope.

Let's say I configure < ITEM > as the new, all-containing root:

<ROOT>
    <SUBROOT>
        <MOVEME>moveme</MOVEME>
        <ITEM>
            <AAA>111</AAA>
        </ITEM>
        <ITEM>
            <AAA>111</AAA>
        </ITEM>
    </SUBROOT>
</ROOT>

should become

<NEWROOT>
        <ITEM>
            <MOVEME>moveme</MOVEME>
            <AAA>111</AAA>
        </ITEM>
        <ITEM>
            <MOVEME>moveme</MOVEME>
            <AAA>111</AAA>
        </ITEM>
</NEWROOT>

What would be a high-performance-solution? Thanks!

items.body_markdown:
I am currently working with an exe (complex hydrogeological model) that requires some 40 to 60 parameters and input files that are defined in a GUI. The settings/configuration for the model can be saved in a XML file that can be opened and edited in the GUI, after which you simply press a button 'load data' and 'start simulation'.   
However, I wish to run the model various times with different XML files (thus a different configuration). As the computational time for one run is about 8 hours, I want my pc to start the next simulation even when I am not at the office in order to save time. Hence I am basically trying to write a batch file to:  
1. Open exe  
2. Load the parameters and input files using the XML  
3. run the model  
4. change to directory containing different XML and subsequent files  
1. "  
2. "
and so on.  

I have something like:

    echo off
    title CLiDE Auto
    cd D:\MyDirectory\		% Directory containing input data and exe
    "CLiDE 2.0_DF"          % the exe (step 1)
    ?				        % command to load XML? (step 2)
    ?				        % command to run exe with configuration specified by XML ? (step 3) 
    cd D:\MyDirectory2\		% Directory containing new input data (step 4)  

I hope anyone has some tips or alternative options as I can't seem to find a suitable approach for steps 2 and 3. 

**Note** : The model is written in C. I do have access to the code but I don't have any experience with coding in C. 

Cheers!
items.title: Load XML configuration for executable in a batch
items.body:
I am currently working with an exe (complex hydrogeological model) that requires some 40 to 60 parameters and input files that are defined in a GUI. The settings/configuration for the model can be saved in a XML file that can be opened and edited in the GUI, after which you simply press a button 'load data' and 'start simulation'.
However, I wish to run the model various times with different XML files (thus a different configuration). As the computational time for one run is about 8 hours, I want my pc to start the next simulation even when I am not at the office in order to save time. Hence I am basically trying to write a batch file to:
1. Open exe
2. Load the parameters and input files using the XML
3. run the model
4. change to directory containing different XML and subsequent files
1. "
2. " and so on.

I have something like:

echo off
title CLiDE Auto
cd D:\MyDirectory\      % Directory containing input data and exe
"CLiDE 2.0_DF"          % the exe (step 1)
?                       % command to load XML? (step 2)

cd D:\MyDirectory2\     % Directory containing new input data (step 4)

I hope anyone has some tips or alternative options as I can't seem to find a suitable approach for steps 2 and 3.

Note : The model is written in C. I do have access to the code but I don't have any experience with coding in C.

Cheers!

items.title: How to inject document.body in angular 2
items.body:
I want to add some text in showlist.component.html , my showlist.component.ts code is given below, i am not aware as how can i use document.body in angular 2. Please guide

import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core';
import { DOCUMENT } from '@angular/platform-browser';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-showlist',
  templateUrl: './showlist.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./showlist.component.css']
})
export class ShowlistComponent implements OnInit {

public myname = "saurabh";

  constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
//this.myname.appendTo(document.body);
document.body(this.myname);
 //document.write(this.myname);
  }

}

items.title: Audio Effect in Swift 4.1
items.body:
@available(iOS 11.0, *)
func addChipmunkEffect(audioURL: URL, audioName: String) {

    // audioPlayerNode
    audioPlayerNode = AVAudioPlayerNode()

    // audioUnitTimePitch
    audioUnitTimePitch = AVAudioUnitTimePitch()
    audioUnitTimePitch.pitch = 1000

    audioUnit2 = AVAudioUnitDelay()

    // audioFile
    do {
        inputAudioFile = try AVAudioFile(forReading: audioURL)
    } catch {
        myPrint("Could not init inputAudioFile. Error: \(error.localizedDescription)")
        return
    }

    // audioEngine
    audioEngine = AVAudioEngine()
    audioEngine.attach(audioPlayerNode)
    audioEngine.attach(audioUnitTimePitch)
    audioEngine.attach(audioUnit2)

    audioEngine.connect(audioPlayerNode, to: audioUnitTimePitch, format: inputAudioFile.processingFormat)
    audioEngine.connect(audioUnitTimePitch, to: audioUnit2, format: inputAudioFile.processingFormat)
    audioEngine.connect(audioUnit2, to: audioEngine.mainMixerNode, format: inputAudioFile.processingFormat)

    // schedule source file
    audioPlayerNode.scheduleFile(inputAudioFile, at: nil)

    exportEffectedAudioFile(audioName: audioName)
}

@available(iOS 11.0, *)
private func exportEffectedAudioFile(audioName: String) {

    /// enableManualRendering .offline
    do {
        let maximumFrameCount: AVAudioFrameCount = 4096
        try audioEngine.enableManualRenderingMode(.offline, format: inputAudioFile.processingFormat, maximumFrameCount: maximumFrameCount)
    } catch {
        myPrint("Could not enable offline rendering mode. Error: \(error.localizedDescription)")
        return
    }

    let paths: [URL] = FileManager.default.urls(for: .documentDirectory, in: .userDomainMask)
    let documentDirectory: URL = paths[0]

    let name = audioName + "_chipmunk"
    let outputURL = documentDirectory.appendingPathComponent("\(name).m4a")
    myPrint(outputURL)

    do {
        outputAudioFile = try AVAudioFile(forWriting: outputURL, settings: inputAudioFile.fileFormat.settings)
    } catch {
        myPrint("Cout not init outputAudioFile. Error: \(error.localizedDescription)")
        return
    }

    // start
    do {
        try self.audioEngine.start()
        self.audioPlayerNode.play()
    } catch {
        myPrint("Coult not start audioEngine. Error: \(error.localizedDescription)")
        return
    }

    // buffer
    let buffer = AVAudioPCMBuffer(pcmFormat: audioEngine.manualRenderingFormat, frameCapacity: audioEngine.manualRenderingMaximumFrameCount)!

    // didExportSuccess check
    var didExportSuccess = true

    // export
    let queue = DispatchQueue(label: "exportAffectedAudio")
    queue.async {
        while self.audioEngine.manualRenderingSampleTime < self.inputAudioFile.length {
            do {
                // frameCapacity || remaining frame
                let framesToRender = min(buffer.frameCapacity, AVAudioFrameCount(self.inputAudioFile.length - self.audioEngine.manualRenderingSampleTime))

                // render each frames until full length
                let status = try self.audioEngine.renderOffline(framesToRender, to: buffer)

                switch status {
                case .success:
                    try self.outputAudioFile.write(from: buffer)
                    //myPrint("ok")
                default:
                    myPrint("render frames not success")
                    didExportSuccess = false
                }
            } catch {
                didExportSuccess = false
                myPrint("try renderOffline, try write. Error: \(error.localizedDescription)")
                return
            }
        }

        DispatchQueue.main.async {
            myPrint("finished")
            // finish
            self.audioPlayerNode.stop()
            self.audioEngine.stop()

            if didExportSuccess {
                do {
                    self.player2 = try AVAudioPlayer(contentsOf: outputURL)
                    self.player2.play()
                } catch {
                    myPrint("Error: \(error)")
                }

            }
        }
    }
}

6 months ago I did export effected audio file using the code that is similar to above code and it did work well. But now i can't play the exported audio file. Anything goes wrong here? I have a local audio file, then using audio engine, add some audio units effect, then export file. Any try catch, guard let pass through

items.body_markdown:
I recently switched from angularJs to Angular 6. 

In angularJs, it was quite easy to add a debounce timer via `ng-model-options`. 
However, in Angular 6 I fail to find any method that does the same.

Im currently building a form using the template-driven approach with a bunch of validator-directives.

Did something go over my head? Do I have to use Reactive Form to debounce?

While quite a few questions here on SO discuss this problematic, I havent yet seen one that has the angular 6 context. 
It seems like a lot was changed in angular 6 regarding observables and rxjs.
items.title: Debouncing entire form in angular 6
items.body:
I recently switched from angularJs to Angular 6.

In angularJs, it was quite easy to add a debounce timer via ng-model-options. However, in Angular 6 I fail to find any method that does the same.

Im currently building a form using the template-driven approach with a bunch of validator-directives.

Did something go over my head? Do I have to use Reactive Form to debounce?

While quite a few questions here on SO discuss this problematic, I havent yet seen one that has the angular 6 context. It seems like a lot was changed in angular 6 regarding observables and rxjs.

items.title: Show items in listview if the chosen dates lays in between a booking
items.body:
I have two datepickers that shows items in a listview depending on which dates you choose different items show up. I need to show items in listview if the chosen dates lays in between a booking. I've not managed to to this but this is what I've done so far:

These are the two dates from datepickers:

public DateTime SDate
    {
        get
        {
            return sDate;
        }

        set
        {
            startDate = value;
        }
    }


    public DateTime EDate
    {
        get
        {
            return eDate;
        }

        set
        {
            eDate = value;
        }
    }

This is the method that tells me what date that booking is:

public DateTime Date
    {
        get;
        set;
    }

And here comes the tricky part for me. Cannot figure out how to check the dates and then also add payment.Date.Value to it. This is as far as I've gotten:

Date = (SDate - EDate) = payment.Date.Value

Appreciate all the help. Thanks.

items.title: Where am i getting this bus error?
items.body:
When I compile this code I experience a bus error and I don't understand what I'm doing to cause this. I read up what a bus error entails and I still don't quite see my problem. This code should reproduce the behaviour of the strcpy() function in the string.h library.

#include <unistd.h>

void	ft_putstr(char *str)
{
	while (*str)
		write(1, str++, 1);
}

char	*ft_strcpy(char *dest, char *src)
{
	int	index;

	index = 0;
	while (src[index] != '\0')
	{
		dest[index] = src[index];
		index++;
	}
	dest[index] = '\0';
	return (dest);
}

int	main(void)
{
	char *str1, *str2, *cpy;

	str1 = "Cameron";
	str2 = "Why you no work?";
	cpy = ft_strcpy(str1, str2);
	ft_putstr(cpy);
	return (0);
}

I am trying to concatenate CSV files from a folder in my desktop: 

<!-- language: lang-none -->

    C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W1 

and output the final CSV to:

<!-- language: lang-none -->

    C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W2\\conca.csv

The CSV files don't have header. However, nothing come out when I run my script, and no error message. I'm a beginner, can someone have a look at my code below, Thanks a lot!

    import os
    import glob
    import pandas
    
    def concatenate(indir="C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W1",outfile="C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W2\\conca.csv"):
        os.chdir(indir)
        fileList=glob.glob("indir")

            df=pandas.read_csv(filename,header=None)

items.title: Python - Concatenate CSV files in a specific directory
items.body:
I am trying to concatenate CSV files from a folder in my desktop: 

C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W1

and output the final CSV to:

C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W2\\conca.csv

The CSV files don't have header. However, nothing come out when I run my script, and no error message. I'm a beginner, can someone have a look at my code below, Thanks a lot!

import os
import glob
import pandas

def concatenate(indir="C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W1",outfile="C:\\Users\\Vincentc\\Desktop\\W2\\conca.csv"):
    os.chdir(indir)
    fileList=glob.glob("indir")
    dfList=[]
    for filename in fileList:
        print(filename)
        df=pandas.read_csv(filename,header=None)
        dfList.append(df)
    concaDf=pandas.concat(dfList,axis=0)
    concaDf.to_csv(outfile,index=None)

items.title: Java subclass method override father method
items.body:
Lets assume that i have something like that

public class Child1 extends Father{
    public void run(){
        mymethod();
    }
}


public class Child2 extends Father{       
    @Override
    protected boolean mymethod(){
        if(...){
            return true;
        }
        super.mymethod() //calls the method on father class if reach to this statement
    }
}


public class Father{
    protected boolean my method(){
    }
}

Here is my code structure. Lets pretend that i reach the statement mymethod() on the class Child1, and then i want to advance to the mymethod on the class child2 instead of the father method. And one thing important: i can't change the mymethod() on Father class. So, it is possible to do this flow:

Child1 -> Child 2 -> return true
or
Child1 -> Child 2 -> (goto if "if statement" fail) Father

Thanks in advance

items.title: How to authorize CORS preflight request on IIS with Windows Authentication
items.body:
I have an API on ASP.net Core 2 (windows authentication) and a front on angular. I make a cors configuration to querying my backend from the SPA angular, but im blocked in cause of the preflight who are rejected from the IIS server because he don't have identification information.

error message : 

Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'http://XXXXXX' is therefore not allowed access. The response had HTTP status code 401.

code side front : 

//MY HEADER
private headers = new Headers({
    'Content-Type': 'application/json', 
    'Access-Control-Allow-Credentials':'true',
    'Access-Control-Allow-Origin':'true'
});

//REQUEST
let options = new RequestOptions({headers:this.headers, withCredentials:true});
return this.http.get(this.tasksUrl,options).map(res=>res.json());

code side back : (Startup.cs)

public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
{
   services.AddCors();
   services.AddCors(options =>
   {
       options.AddPolicy("AllowSpecificOrigin",
            builder =>
            {
               builder.WithOrigins("http://theURLofTheFront:8080" )
               .AllowAnyMethod()
               .AllowAnyHeader()
               .AllowCredentials();
            });
   });
public void Configure(IApplicationBuilder app, IHostingEnvironment env, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory)
    {
        loggerFactory.AddConsole(Configuration.GetSection("Logging"));
        loggerFactory.AddDebug();
        app.UseCors("AllowSpecificOrigin");
        app.UseMvc();
    }

I try this :

CORS preflight request returning HTTP 401 with windows authentication.

and i added custom header to specify the 'Acces-control-allow-origin' on IIS, dont work for me.

and this dont work for me : https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/friis/2017/11/24/putting-it-all-together-cors-tutorial/

I can't remove the default authorization rule.

I thank you in advance for you

items.body_markdown:
When I'm trying to set a normal value in Local Storage using [Ionic Storage](https://ionicframework.com/docs/storage/). 

It gives the following issue[![It gives the following issue][1]][1]

It works fine in ionic android applications on premium phones (Having high performance). 

But on budget android phones, when that mobile has memory issue such as having less than a GB available memory space. Inserting the first value in local storage it throws "QuotaExceededError". Which disable my app to use its local storage on that particular phone.

How can I address this issue?


  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/nOqGu.jpg

items.title: Running cmd.exe through start-process but unable to pass the command to cmd.exe
items.body:
I want to run a groovy script with cmd.exe under a different user.

I have used Start-Process, when the script gets executed it just opens the prompt on the screen with different user but doesn't process the $command.

So my question is "How to pass the command after running cmd.exe with PowerShell?

This is what I have so far:

$username = "abc"
$pwd = ConvertTo -SecureString "xyz" -AsPlainText -Force
$cred = New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList $username $pw

$command = "filepath/.groovy"

try {
    Start-Process 'cmd' -Credential $cred -ArgumentList $command
    Write-Host $LASTEXITCODE
    if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
        throw "Error occured"
    } else {
        return 0
    }
} catch {
    Write-Error "Error Desc:$_Error.InnerException.Message";
}

items.title: Wp_query pagination
items.body:
I've tried to add pagination to the below wp_query (generated using a online tool), and I'm failing miserably.

I've seen examples which see a paged value added, and then called as part of the wp_query. However I'm getting errors.

$paged = ( get_query_var( 'paged' ) ) ? get_query_var( 'paged' ) : 1;

Can someone please advise given the below, how i can add pagination?

<?php 
// WP_Query arguments
$args = array(
'post_type'              => array( 'post' ),
'post_status'            => array( 'publish' ),
'nopaging'               => false,
'posts_per_page'         => '2',
'order'                  => 'DESC',
'orderby'                => 'date',
);

// The Query
$query = new WP_Query( $args );

// The Loop
if ( $query->have_posts() ) {
    while ( $query->have_posts() ) {
        $query->the_post();
        the_title( '<h3 class="entry-title"><a href="' . esc_url( get_permalink() ) . '" rel="bookmark">', '</a></h3>' );
        the_excerpt();
        }
    } else {
    // no posts found
    }

// Restore original Post Data
wp_reset_postdata();

?>

items.title: MYSQL Workbench db error while creating table
items.body:
I am trying to create a table with a foreign key from another table:

CREATE TABLE `heroku_abcd`.`id_photos` (
    id_id int NOT NULL,
    idFrontURL varchar(10000),
    idBackURL varchar(10000),
    selfieURL varchar(10000),
    PRIMARY KEY (id_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES customers(id)
)

this error came out instead: Operation failed: There was an error while applying the SQL script to the database. ERROR 1046: No database selected

items.title: Can a concept require a constexpr value or function?
items.body:
So, I'd like to do some advanced type-level hackery for which I would really like to be able to write a concept that requires a type to have a constexpr int value associated with it, which I can use later in the same concept as the integer std::array template parameter.

It's possible to write

template<typename T>
concept bool HasCount = requires {
    typename T::count;
};

but this is not what I want; I would like T::count to be a static constexpr int. However, the code (not even including the needed constexpr)

template<typename T>
concept bool HasCount = requires {
    int T::count;
};

does not compile with "error: expected primary-expression before 'int'" on GCC 7.3.0.

Another failed attempt: it's possible to write this, which would require static int T::count():

template<typename T>
concept bool HasCount = requires {
    {T::count()} -> int;
};

but not this, which is what I want:

template<typename T>
concept bool HasCount = requires {
    {T::count()} -> constexpr int;
    {T::count() constexpr} -> int; // or this
    {constexpr T::count()} -> int; // or this (please forgive me for fuzzing GCC instead of reading the manual, unlike perl C++ is not an empirical science)
};

So, I'd like to know if it's in any way possible to require a concept expression to be constexpr-qualified, or if not if there's a reason why it can't be possible, or if it's just not included in the specification.

items.body_markdown:
With training & validation through a dataset for nearly 24 epochs, intermittently 8 epochs at once and saving weights cumulatively after each interval. 

I observed a constant declining train & test-loss for first 16 epochs, post which the training loss continues to fall whereas test loss rises so i think it's the case of Overfitting.


For which i tried to resume training with weights saved after 16 epochs with change in hyperparameters say **increasing dropout_rate** a little.
Therefore i reran the dense & transition blocks with new dropout to get identical architecture with same sequence & learnable parameters count.


Now when i'm assigning previous weights to my new model(with new dropout) with **model.load_weights()** and **compiling thereafter**.
i see the training loss is even higher, that should be initially (blatantly with increased inactivity of random nodes during training) but later also it's performing quite unsatisfactory,
so i'm suspecting maybe compiling after loading pretrained weights might have ruined the performance? 

what's reasoning & recommended sequence of **model.load_weights()** & **model.compile()**? i'd really appreciate any insights on above case.
items.title: should model.compile() be run prior to using model.load_weights(), if model has been only slightly changed say dropout?
items.body:
With training & validation through a dataset for nearly 24 epochs, intermittently 8 epochs at once and saving weights cumulatively after each interval.

I observed a constant declining train & test-loss for first 16 epochs, post which the training loss continues to fall whereas test loss rises so i think it's the case of Overfitting.

For which i tried to resume training with weights saved after 16 epochs with change in hyperparameters say increasing dropout_rate a little. Therefore i reran the dense & transition blocks with new dropout to get identical architecture with same sequence & learnable parameters count.

Now when i'm assigning previous weights to my new model(with new dropout) with model.load_weights() and compiling thereafter. i see the training loss is even higher, that should be initially (blatantly with increased inactivity of random nodes during training) but later also it's performing quite unsatisfactory, so i'm suspecting maybe compiling after loading pretrained weights might have ruined the performance?

what's reasoning & recommended sequence of model.load_weights() & model.compile()? i'd really appreciate any insights on above case.

items.title: React: _this.state is undefined
items.body:
I wrote the following snippet:

export class Kurse extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);

    this.state = {termineFreiburg: [
      {date: "21.02.2019", free: 10}, 
      {date: "02.05.2018", free: 0}, 
      {date: "13.03.2018", free: 10}, 
      {date: "04.07.2018", free: 12}, 
      {date: "05.08.2018", free: 12}
    ],
                termineKarlsruhe:[
      {date: "09.03.2019", free: 2},
      {date: "12.01.2018", free: 5}
    ]}
  }

  stadt = this.props.location.stadt;

  listItemsFreiburg = this.state.termineFreiburg.map((termin) =>
  <p><Link to={{pathname: "/bookCourse", datum: termin.date, stadt: this.props.location.stadt}}><Button>{termin.date}   Freie Plätze:  {(termin.free > 0)?termin.free:'ausgebucht'}</Button></Link></p>);

  listItemsKarlsruhe = this.state.termineKarlsruhe.map((termin) =>
  <p><Link to={{pathname: "/bookCourse", datum: termin.date, stadt: this.props.location.stadt}}><Button>{termin.date}   Freie Plätze:   </Button></Link></p>);

  render() {
    return(
      <div>
        <h2>Wähle Deinen Wunschtermin für einen Kurs in {this.props.location.stadt}</h2>
        {(this.props.location.stadt === 'Freiburg') ? this.listItemsFreiburg : this.listItemsKarlsruhe}
      </div>
    );
  }
}


export default Kurse;

Expected result:

I expect that the dates will appear on the website (the app page).

Actual result:

I get "_this.state is not defined" with "constructor(props)" being highlighted.

As soon as I take the snippet with the dates out of the constructor all works fine!?

Any help? Or hints?

items.title: Is there a way to pretty print Swift dictionaries to the console?
items.body:
NSDictionary *dictionary = @{@"A" : @"alfa",
                             @"B" : @"bravo",
                             @"C" : @"charlie",
                             @"D" : @"delta",
                             @"E" : @"echo",
                             @"F" : @"foxtrot"};
NSLog(@"%@", dictionary.description);

prints out the following on the console:

{
    A = alfa;
    B = bravo;
    C = charlie;
    D = delta;
    E = echo;
    F = foxtrot;
}

let dictionary: [String : String] = ["A" : "alfa",
                                     "B" : "bravo",
                                     "C" : "charlie",
                                     "D" : "delta",
                                     "E" : "echo",
                                     "F" : "foxtrot"];
print(dictionary)

prints out the following on the console:

["B": "bravo", "A": "alfa", "F": "foxtrot", "C": "charlie", "D": "delta", "E": "echo"]

Is there a way in Swift to get it to pretty print dictionaries where each key-value pair occupies a new line?

items.body_markdown:
I have tried using a setting `{mail_relay_use_tls, always}` but it seems not to deliver mails.

I have tried using other clients like PHPMailer, Node.js or Ruby on Rails with `secure: true` and `ssl: true` options and mails did arrive.

I need to set something like `{mail_relay_use_ssl, always}` with Chicago Boss.

P.S. If I disable SSL on SMTP server side, then Chicago Boss sends out mails, but I need to have SSL enabled.
items.title: How to set SSL true to Chicago Boss's mail_relay config?
items.body:
I have tried using a setting {mail_relay_use_tls, always} but it seems not to deliver mails.

I have tried using other clients like PHPMailer, Node.js or Ruby on Rails with secure: true and ssl: true options and mails did arrive.

I need to set something like {mail_relay_use_ssl, always} with Chicago Boss.

P.S. If I disable SSL on SMTP server side, then Chicago Boss sends out mails, but I need to have SSL enabled.

items.title: javascript change color in generated table
items.body:
Hi I try to create a little code where a use can put in how many tables and how may rows and which color each should have. Everything is working so far exept the color change. I set the variable and try to put that into the header, but it will only accept this as text, not as a variable. I hope someone could tell me what I'm doing wrong. Thank you in advance.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width">
    <meta name="description" content="Table Form">
    <meta name="keywords" content="Modulor, Test, Frontend Development,      Table Form">
    <meta name="author" content="Shirin Doroudian">
    <title>Table Form</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style3.css">
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Lato" rel="stylesheet">
    <script type="text/javascript">
        function createTable() {
            var rowVar = document.getElementById('row').value;
            var columnVar = document.getElementById('column').value;
            var firstcolor =  document.getElementById('first-color').value;
            var fheader = '<table border="1" bgcolor = (firstcolor)>\n';

            var fbody = '';
            for( var i=0; i<rowVar;i++) {
                fbody += '<tr>';
                for( var j=0; j<columnVar;j++) {
                    fbody += '<td>';
                    fbody += '';
                    fbody += '</td>'
                }
                fbody += '</tr>\n';
            }

            var ffooter = '</table>';
            document.getElementById('table').innerHTML =  fheader +  fbody + ffooter ;
        }
    </script>
</head>

<body>
    <div id="container">
        <div id="left-side">
            <h1>Create your customized table!</h1>
            <form name="table" id="form">
                <div class="form-row">
                    <label class="form-label" for="row">Choose number of rows (2-10):</label>
                    <input type="number" min="2" max="10" name="row" id="row">
                </div>
                <div class="form-row">
                    <label class="form-label" for="column">Choose number of columns (2-10):</label>
                    <input type="number" min="2" max="10" name="column" id="column">
                </div>
                <div class="form-row">
                        <label class="form-label" for="first-color">Choose the first color:</label>
                        <input type="color" name="first-color" id="first-color" >
                    </div>
                    <div class="form-row">
                        <label class="form-label" for="second-color">Choose the second color:</label>
                        <input type="color" name="second-color" id="second-color" >
                    </div>
                <input name="generate" id="button-form" type="button" class="button form-row" value="Create Table!" onclick='createTable();'>
            </form>
        </div>
        <div id="right-side">
            <div id="table"></div>
        </div>
    </div>
</body>
